page.title: 01Machynlleth and Dyfi valley
page.content: The market town of Machynlleth rests on the river Dyfi which is crossed via an old arched bridge. Trout and even salmon are still quite plentiful. The surrounding area is predominantly a mixture of cultivated and uncultivated farming land, some of which has been pruchased by the Forestry Commision. There are a few small industries but the two main ones are agriculture and tourism the latter applying more to late spring and summer which turns the character and quiet nature of the area into an exciting and bustling place. there are several interesting and historical buildings. Notably amongst these are Owain Glyndwr Senate House The Town Clock and the Plas (Mansion) Although the area, in recent years has become more anglicised, Welsh remains an importnt and much used language for business and community
